intro: Bupleurum aira, commonly known as the common bugloss, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its root system is fibrous and shallow. Bupleurum aira is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
